column4: hey guys, im stuck in a "$" -sh command promp and i want to log out "logout" doesnt work, how do i get out of it?
exit?
thanks!! it worked
the /bin/sh is just another BASH type deal right?
it was the original basis for bash from the year 1605, yes - bash without all the features ;-)

ok guys so im having trouble running a .run file to install files needed to run my q3 server, i looked it up and it said to try and emulate it to 32 bit with "linux32" command, but the install still fails, what flags with the "linux32" command could i try?
you might need to install some 32-bit compatability libs, what's the exact problem you're seeing?
apt-get install ia32-libs
it spits out "This installation doesn't support glibc-2.1 on Linux / unknown"
oh :( dunno then, sorry
do you know the names of the packages your talking about?
ia32-libs, but I'm not sure they'll help now :(
I'd hassle whoever made your .run file :)
yeah, ill install that 32bit compatibility file and see what happens, thanks for the great help/suggestions
good luck!
is there a way to only extract the files out of a .run so i could place them manually instaed of letting the .run do it?
well, you could experiment with editing the file (the first 10 lines are likely to be a shell script to unpack the rest of the data) and removing any lines that look like they're *running* anything
i can edit the .run in something like pico, right?
yeah probably, those kind of files are usually a few lines of shell script then a big bunch of binary data right beaneath it
you might be able to get *just* the data and unpack it
awsome, thanks for the help again!
good luck!
